On Jan 5, 2005, at 5:43 AM, Harald M. Muller wrote:

> when you last wrote a library (say of a few 100 classes) and delivered
> it to customers (internal, external), and you decided (what I always 
> do)
> that you delivered it including all test cases and test classes (i.e.
> the complete test suite), did you then
> a) include Javadoc for the testsuite classes
> b) deliver a separate Javadoc for the testsuite classes
> c) not deliver any Javadoc for the testsuite classes
> ?

FWIW, I don't deliver JavaDoc for test classes.  I generally don't put 
JavaDoc tags in my test classes, so any generated JavaDoc would simply 
show the class and method names.  You get that same information when 
you run the tests.
